messages.title: Lib Dems deliver
messages.content: TAX CUTS FOR 27 MILLION. HELP FOR FAMILIES. MENTAL HEALTH EQUALITY.

messages.title: Stronger economy, fairer society Opportunity for everyone.
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats are building a strong economy and a fairer society to create opportunity for all.

messages.title: More steps to a fairer Britain
messages.content: OUR RECORD OF ACTION: Cut the deficit in half and helped firms create 1.8 million new jobs. Forced Osborne to bring in an £825 tax cut for 27 million earners.

messages.title: OUR PROMISE OF MORE
messages.content: We'll finish the job of balancing the books, as fairly as possible. We'll protect education spending and equality of opportunity.

messages.title: GREEN: but practical!
messages.content: The Lib Dems are green - but practical. We forced the Tories to confront climate change with a Green Deal, more renewable power and rail electrification.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Balancing the budget, not borrowing when can't afford it, and creating jobs while cutting taxes for 27 million workers.
Free school meals for 4 to 7-year-olds, pupil premiums of £2.5 billion a year, and opposing two tier exams or schools.
Increase the NHS budget by £8bn and guarantee mental health equality.
Invest in green and sustainable. Want new green laws so Britain can prosper and be truly sustainable.

mentions.candidate: John Redfern, A Biddulph resident for 40 years, John Redfern campaigns strongly on local issues. He knows the concerns of local people.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Ed Miliband's Labour, Ed Balls, George Osborne
mentions.tacticalSituation: John Redfern is a local candidate who stands for a Stronger Economy and a Fairer Society with local priorities.

issues.economy: The Liberal Democrats are building a strong economy and a fairer society. Balancing the budget and creating jobs.
issues.education: £825 tax cut to help families. £2.5bn pupil premiums and free school meals for 4 to 7-year-olds.
issues.environment: Green Deal, more renewable power and rail electrification.
issues.health: Increase the NHS budget with 6,000 more doctors than in 2010.

leaflet.personalStatement: John says: "Lib Dems in government have delivered substantial tax cuts of £825 to families who live in the low-wage economy like the Moorlands area. I want local people to benefit from opportunities to improve skills and training. This will help to lift local incomes and encourage enterprise."

politicalExperience.achievements: John has represented Moorlands residents for 20 years as a councillor. He knows the concerns of local people.

contactInformation.address: RETURN TO: John Redfern, FREEPOST RRLJ-YA-RRUX, Endon Bank, Church Lane, Endon, Stoke-on-Trent ST9 9HF

quotes.text: Our triple lock guarantee on pensions has improved the standard of living for the elderly. I will work to tackle poverty and hardship throughout the Moorlands.

images.caption: Pictures of John Redfern and Liberal Democrat promotional materials.
